abstract: The underwriters of the public offering of Groupon shares, the hottest of the year, seemed to have overlooked signs of problems at the start-up.
snippet: The underwriters of the public offering of Groupon shares, the hottest of the year, seemed to have overlooked signs of problems at the start-up.
lead_paragraph: This summer, Lloyd Blankfein, the chief executive of Goldman Sachs, flew to Chicago to personally pitch his firm to underwrite what was supposed to be the hottest initial public offering of the year: Groupon, the fledgling online coupon company that was being valued at around $30 billion.

headline.main: The Missed Red Flags on Groupon
